values.description:
This is the first PR for the Prius cup. 

The reset button has no effect, because the cloudsim-sim instance in AWS does not understand the command.

Next PR will feature better wait states for the buttons and a wait animation.

Thanks for trying it out.
values.title: Prius gui one instance

summary.raw:
This is the first PR for the Prius cup. 

The reset button has no effect, because the cloudsim-sim instance in AWS does not understand the command.

Next PR will feature better wait states for the buttons and a wait animation.

Thanks for trying it out.
summary.html:
This is the first PR for the Prius cup.

The reset button has no effect, because the cloudsim-sim instance in AWS does not understand the command.

Next PR will feature better wait states for the buttons and a wait animation.

Thanks for trying it out.

values.description:
As part of this PR I've just applied some minor changes to make the SRC registration process work again, as well as other change to follow resource file naming conventions from here: #!/osrf/cloudsim/wiki/Server%20structure. 

 List of changes:

* fixed srcsignups urls. Made them plural

* Displayed srcbanner (the ugly way, just added it) when the user is not competitor nor organizer

* Renamed registrations.js to srcsignups.js to follow conventions

@chapulina could you please take a look?
values.title: Revive src kiosk

summary.raw:
As part of this PR I've just applied some minor changes to make the SRC registration process work again, as well as other change to follow resource file naming conventions from here: #!/osrf/cloudsim/wiki/Server%20structure. 

 List of changes:

* fixed srcsignups urls. Made them plural

* Displayed srcbanner (the ugly way, just added it) when the user is not competitor nor organizer

* Renamed registrations.js to srcsignups.js to follow conventions

@chapulina could you please take a look?
summary.html:
As part of this PR I've just applied some minor changes to make the SRC registration process work again, as well as other change to follow resource file naming conventions from here: #!/osrf/cloudsim/wiki/Server%20structure.

List of changes:

  • fixed srcsignups urls. Made them plural

  • Displayed srcbanner (the ugly way, just added it) when the user is not competitor nor organizer

  • Renamed registrations.js to srcsignups.js to follow conventions

@chapulina could you please take a look?

values.description:
This is part of the efforts to put default and production in sync (issue #39).

The server status was merged into default but never made it to production. We can always bring it back in the future if we want to, but for now let's just remove it.
values.title: Remove cs-serverstatus

summary.raw:
This is part of the efforts to put default and production in sync (issue #39).

The server status was merged into default but never made it to production. We can always bring it back in the future if we want to, but for now let's just remove it.
summary.html:
This is part of the efforts to put default and production in sync (issue #39).

The server status was merged into default but never made it to production. We can always bring it back in the future if we want to, but for now let's just remove it.

values.description:
Add an interface to the machine types routes on the portal

* All users will see the widget

    ![mt01.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2342153592-mt01.png)

    * Users who have no permissions to any machine types will have an empty list
    * Users who have read or write permissions to machine types will see those on the list
    * Users who have permission to create machine types (`machinetypes` resource on portal) will see the creation widget

* Selecting a machine type opens the machine type dialog

    ![mt02..png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1219241181-mt02..png)

    ![mt03.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/564567790-mt03.png)

    * Users with read permission will not see the edit, share and delete widget

* Users with write permission to `machinetypes` will have a share button to grant other users permission to create machine types too 

    ![mt04.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3290481669-mt04.png)
values.title: Machine types widget

summary.raw:
Add an interface to the machine types routes on the portal

* All users will see the widget

    ![mt01.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2342153592-mt01.png)

    * Users who have no permissions to any machine types will have an empty list
    * Users who have read or write permissions to machine types will see those on the list
    * Users who have permission to create machine types (`machinetypes` resource on portal) will see the creation widget

* Selecting a machine type opens the machine type dialog

    ![mt02..png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1219241181-mt02..png)

    ![mt03.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/564567790-mt03.png)

    * Users with read permission will not see the edit, share and delete widget

* Users with write permission to `machinetypes` will have a share button to grant other users permission to create machine types too 

    ![mt04.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3290481669-mt04.png)
summary.html:
Add an interface to the machine types routes on the portal

  • All users will see the widget

    • Users who have no permissions to any machine types will have an empty list
    • Users who have read or write permissions to machine types will see those on the list
    • Users who have permission to create machine types (machinetypes resource on portal) will see the creation widget

  • Selecting a machine type opens the machine type dialog

    • Users with read permission will not see the edit, share and delete widget

  • Users with write permission to machinetypes will have a share button to grant other users permission to create machine types too

values.description:
* Download SSH keys
* Download VPN keys
* Display machine status, ip
* The "Practice mode" box will not be available during the finals
* Buttons to start / stop processes on the instances. They're already sending posts, but the instance is not handling them yet. These are the routes:

    ### Simulator
    * `POST /start/n` : Start simulation with world n
    * `POST /stop` : Stop current simulation world

    ### Field computer
    * `POST /start` : Start user code
    * `POST /stop` : Stop user code

![srck.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/402983129-srck.png)
values.title: More SRC

summary.raw:
* Download SSH keys
* Download VPN keys
* Display machine status, ip
* The "Practice mode" box will not be available during the finals
* Buttons to start / stop processes on the instances. They're already sending posts, but the instance is not handling them yet. These are the routes:

    ### Simulator
    * `POST /start/n` : Start simulation with world n
    * `POST /stop` : Stop current simulation world

    ### Field computer
    * `POST /start` : Start user code
    * `POST /stop` : Stop user code

![srck.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/402983129-srck.png)
summary.html:
• Download SSH keys
  • Download VPN keys
  • Display machine status, ip
  • The "Practice mode" box will not be available during the finals

  • Buttons to start / stop processes on the instances. They're already sending posts, but the instance is not handling them yet. These are the routes:

    Simulator

    • POST /start/n : Start simulation with world n
    • POST /stop : Stop current simulation world

    Field computer

    • POST /start : Start user code
    • POST /stop : Stop user code
